data.test_name: Some Basic Concepts of Chemistry and Stoichiometry (Hard)

1.q_string: Stoichiometric air-fuel ratio by volume for combustion of methane in air is:

A solution containing \(5 \mathrm{~g}\) of \(\mathrm{KOH}\) and \(\mathrm{Ca}(\mathrm{OH})_{2}\) is neutralized by an acid. If it consumes \(0.3 \mathrm{~g}\) equivalents of the acid, the composition of the solution is:
How many carbon atoms are present in \(0.5\) moles of oxalic acid \(\left(\mathrm{C}_{2} \mathrm{H}_{2} \mathrm{O}_{4}\right)\)?

\(0.5216 \mathrm{~g}\) of a solid mixture containing \(\mathrm{Na}_{2} \mathrm{SO}_{4}\) is dissolved in water and treated with an excess of \(\mathrm{BaCl}_{2}\), resulting in the precipitation of \(0.6168 \mathrm{~g}\) of \(\mathrm{BaSO}_{4}\). What percentage of the mixture was \(\mathrm{BaSO}_{4}\)?

q_option: Preparation of the sample solution ➝ Precipitation process ➝ Digestion (or) Ostwald ripening ➝ Filtration ➝ Washing ➝ Drying ➝ Igniting
Preparation of the sample solution ➝ Digestion (or) Ostwald ripening ➝ Precipitation process ➝ Filtration ➝ Washing ➝ Drying ➝ Igniting
Preparation of the sample solution ➝ Precipitation process ➝ Digestion (or) Ostwald ripening ➝ Filtration ➝ Washing ➝ Igniting ➝ Drying
Preparation of the sample solution ➝ Digestion (or) Ostwald ripening ➝ Precipitation process ➝ Washing ➝ Filtration ➝ Drying ➝ Igniting
1.q_string: Which of the following is the correct sequence of steps in precipitation gravimetry?
Which of the following is true about excess reagents?
An azeotropic solution of two liquids has boiling point lower than either of them when it:
A compound processes 8% sulphur by mass. The least molecular mass is:

A solution of glucose \(\left(\mathrm{C}_{6} \mathrm{H}_{12} \mathrm{O}_{6}\right)\) in water is labelled as \(10 \%\) by weight. What would be the molality of the solution?

(Molar mass of glucose \(=180 \mathrm{~g} \mathrm{~mol}^{-1}\) )
If we assume that one-sixth the mass of an atom of \({ }^{12} C\) isotope is taken as the reference, the mass of one molecule of oxygen will:
Calculate the mass percent of \(O\) present in sodium sulphate \(\left(\mathrm{Na}_{2} \mathrm{SO}_{4}\right)\).
Calculate the concentration of nitric acid in moles per litre in a sample which has a density \(1.41 \mathrm{gmL}^{-1}\) and the mass per cent of nitric acid in it being \(69 \%\).
Determine the empirical formula of an oxide of iron which has \(69.9 \%\) iron and \(30.1 \%\) dioxygen by mass.

q_option: \(100 \mathrm{~g}\) of water is heated to give steam.
A sample of \(N_{2}\) gas is heated at constant pressure without any change in mass.
\(36 \mathrm{~g}\) of carbon combines with \(32 \mathrm{~g}\) of oxygen to form \(68 \mathrm{~g}\) of \(\mathrm{CO}_{2}\).
\(10 \mathrm{~g}\) of carbon is heated in vacuum without any change in mass.
1.q_string: Which of the following statements best explains the law of conservation of mass, concerning a chemical change?
Which of the following pairs illustrates the law of multiple proportions?
